channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2024070090
item.description:
Report E-2024070090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MILLWOOD
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1824 was punctured in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and neutralizing agent to remediate the sodium hydroxide solution-impacted trailer floor and asphalt. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070041
item.description:
Report E-2024070041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: VALLEY GROVE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped for the night and ws doing a post trip inspection and saw some moisture at the front of the trailer. The driver then called our emergency number at approximately 2030 ET. The team was dispatched and arrived at 2230ET and found the a 5 gallon drums lid had come off and the liquid had splashed over the top. They then removed the container and put it into a salvage drum and wiped up any residue found and disposed of the absorbents in the appropriate manor. The result was less than a gallon released. The clean up was complete at 0330.
